title: Complete the Proverb
description: Can you finish these well-known proverbs and sayings?

questions.explanation: This proverb means that fixing a problem early prevents it from becoming worse.
What you do matters more than what you say.
Those who act promptly have an advantage over others.

questions.proverb: Don't count your chickens before they ___
questions.explanation: Don't assume something will happen before it actually does.

questions.proverb: A penny saved is a penny ___
questions.explanation: Money that you save is just as valuable as money that you earn.

questions.proverb: When in Rome, do as the ___ do
questions.explanation: Adapt your behavior to match the customs of the place you are visiting.
Even in bad situations, there is usually something positive to be found.

questions.proverb: You can't teach an old dog new ___
questions.explanation: It can be difficult to change long-established habits or learn new skills later in life.

questions.proverb: The pen is mightier than the ___
questions.explanation: Writing and communication can be more powerful than physical force.

questions.proverb: An apple a day keeps the ___ away
questions.explanation: Eating healthy food helps you stay well and avoid illness.

questions.proverb: A bird in the hand is worth two in the ___
questions.explanation: It's better to hold onto what you have than to risk losing it by trying to get something better.
Important achievements take time and patience to accomplish.
Responding to a bad action with another bad action doesn't make things better.
If there are signs of a problem, the problem likely exists.
Things that look attractive on the surface may not be as valuable as they appear.
